intro: Spiesia parryi, commonly known as the Parry's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Spiesia parryi is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in desert landscapes.
